title.narrative: Food Security and Inclusive Access to Resources for Conflict Sensitive Market Development (FARM)

description.narrative: Mercy Corps and Search for Common Ground propose a 48-month intervention to improve the socioeconomic and security conditions of about 25,000 households (150,000 men, women, girls and boys) in North Kivu province, DRC. This goal will be achieved through considering all the market actors, systems and functions – as well as contributing contextual factors – that prevent smallholder farmers and small entrepreneurs (impact group) from increasing their incomes and their food security situation. Under Strategic Objective 1, the programme will bring the government and citizenry together to allow the target population to increasingly benefit from quality and accountable state services related to land use, agricultural production and markets. Under Strategic Objective 2, FARM will strengthen and diversify agricultural and non-agricultural livelihoods of target households through increasing their capacity to respond to market demand and ensuring that they sustainably access services and goods that are adapted to their needs from private and public market actors. The programme will be divided into a 6-month inception phase, followed by 2.5 years of extensive support to market actors through facilitative approaches, and one year dedicated to monitoring improved market exchanges and additional programme investments to achieve scale and sustainability. The programme will be implemented in 120 villages, selected across 5 Chefferies of the Goma Hinterland

Outcome 1.1: Systemic constraints to land access, including conflict management systems, are inclusively improved. Outcome 1.2: Barriers to formal control of land are reduced, especially for women and youth. Outcome 2.1: Market actors from different communities collaborate to increase market access, especially for women and youth. Outcome 2.2: Market actors / institutions develop inclusive accessible by vulnerable chain actors Outcome 2.3: Joint-community planning and management improve natural resource use

Armed groups, state actors and community members are sensitized to ensure safe market access, especially for women
# of FARDC members and members of the police force trained on protection and on human rights
# of meetings held with specialized organizations to advocate for their support for road construction and rehabilitation
# of training and sensitization sessions with armed groups on International Humanitarian Law
% of FARDC members and police participating in protection and human rights training who believe that the training will have a positive impact on their actions
Authorities and local government activists have the capacity to advocate for the engagement of women and youth in land control procedures
# Number of land titles delivered in the name of both spouses
# Workshops and workshops with CONAREF on inclusion and gender in land reform

Barriers to market access are reduced
# Villagois Agents trained on the management of VSLAs

Barriers to official land control / access are reduced, especially for women and young people
# of hectares of land made available by concessionaires for the benefit of community members
# of program participants who are able to demonstrate that they have acquired formal and / or customary land titles since the beginning of the program
# of program participants who report having increased their access to dealer lands since the beginning of the program "
% of adults who have confidence in their ability to acquire land control through local land acquisition procedures (formal and / or customary)

Community members, including large landowners, participate in functional and inclusive discussion platforms and mediation mechanisms to resolve conflicts
# local conflict resolution structures that have increased the number of members who are women, youth and / or belong to a minority ethnic group since the beginning of the program .
# platforms for intercommunity dialogue on lands supported by the programme
% of adults who participated in at least one inter-municipal discussion platform on mediation and conflict resolution in the last 6 months

comment.narrative: The actual % reflects the midline value that was recorded in August 2020.

description.narrative: % of adults who report hearing, seeing or following messages about conflict resolution through participatory radio and theater campaigns
Enhanced Producer Organizations Provide Enhanced Services to Members

% of PO members who report using post-harvest innovations (cultivation practices, equipment, post-harvest materials) introduced by the project
% of members of producer organizations declaring use of a new service offered by the PO
% of producer organizations supported by the programme declaring the use of new technologies or management practices
Total volume of crops produced (MT) stored in improved storage facilities (whose construction is supported by the programme)

comment.narrative: No results yet reported on this.

description.narrative: Governance actors improve their ability to facilitate communication between conflicting parties and apply the existing legal framework

% of women and men who rate the territorial government's performance as "very good" or "good" in managing the following themes: a) establish peace; (b) reduce poverty; (c) increase employment; d) fight corruption; e) the unification of the different ethnic groups; f) improve the lives of Congolese; g) provide security; h) combat sexual violence; i) improve daily life at the Territorial / provincial / national level

comment.narrative: Value to be confirmed with I4S
